listData.name: Bendigo Ready Credit Card
listData.description: Bendigo Ready Credit Card lets you enjoy a $0 annual fee - this year and beyond. Also, save with $0 international transaction fees, a range of added insurances, purchase protections, plus access to Mastercard Priceless Cities exclusive experiences and special offers - it's the only card you'll need. Plus you'll receive up to 55 days interest free on purchases.

features.additionalValue: With Bendigo Bank you can turn your phone or smart watch into your wallet.

features.additionalInfo: Up to 90 consecutive days international travel insurance (for persons under 76 years). T&Cs apply.
Cover is activated when you purchase the full value of the covered item with your card. T&Cs apply.
90 day purchase protection on stolen or accidentally damaged purchases when the total cost of the purchase is charged to your participating credit card. T&Cs apply

Purchase the total value of your return domestic travel ticket (and your spouse’s and dependants’ if they’re travelling with you) on your card. You may have cover if your interstate flight is delayed, your luggage is lost or you’ve had to cancel your trip due to illness, injury or death of a relative. T&Cs apply.
The cover is activated when you take legal control of the hire car and the entire rental cost is charged to your card. T&Cs apply.
You must have paid for the full cost of that transportation with your card. T&Cs apply.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Additional cardholders must be 16 years old

fees.name: Annual fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable on the day before we issue the first Statement of Account for your Account and annually thereafter.

fees.name: International Transaction fee
fees.additionalInfo: International Transaction Fee – [0% of the Transaction amount (in AUD)] An International Transaction Fee of 0% of the Transaction amount (in AUD) payable for each Transaction which is conducted in a currency other than Australian dollars (AUD) or in Australian dollars (AUD) but with or using a merchant, payment processor, financial institution or other entity (including an online merchant) who is outside of Australia. Note: It may not always be apparent to you that an online merchant is located outside of Australia.

fees.name: Balance Trasnfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Balance Transfer Fee – [2% of the balance transferred] Payable each time we agree to transfer the balance owing by you in respect of a different credit card facility to your Bendigo Bank Credit Card as a Promotional Balance Transfer.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable each time you fail to pay your Minimum Repayment as stated on a Statement of Account by its due date.

fees.name: Cash Advance Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Cash Advance Fee – $[3.00 or 3% of Transaction amount, whichever is greater] Payable each time we provide credit in the form of cash or you perform a Transaction we treat as being equivalent to cash.

fees.name: International ATM Withdrawal
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever you make a cash withdrawal outside of Australia at a non-Bendigo Bank ATM (in addition to the Cash Advance Fee.

fees.name: International ATM Inquiry
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever you make an Account inquiry outside of Australia at a non-Bendigo Bank ATM.

fees.name: Replacement Card Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we issue you a replacement, reissue or redirection card other than by standard post at your request.

fees.name: Break Cost Fee
fees.additionalInfo:
Payable each time any of the following Break Events occur during a Fixed Rate Period: 
• at your request, we agree to change the Annual Percentage Rate under your Contract; 
• you repay your Loan Account balance in full; or 
• you make an additional repayment (by repaying more than your required repayments 
under your Contract) where the total of all additional repayments you have made 
since the start of the Fixed Rate Period or, if later, the anniversary of that date, that 
exceeds $20,000.00.

fees.additionalInfo: Payable for an agent of the bank to attend the settlement of your property or lodging the security interests attached to your loan

fees.name: Break Cost Fee and Prepayment Fee
fees.additionalInfo:
A Break Cost Fee is payable to us each time any of the following break events occur during a fixed rate period:
•	at your request, we agree to vary your annual percentage rate; or
•	you repay your loan account balance in full.
A Prepayment Fee is payable to us if, during a fixed rate period, you prepay an amount (repay more than your required repayments) that exceeds 20% of:
•	if the fixed rate period started on the date we first advanced any part of the amount of credit, the amount of credit – in which case the prepayment amount is the amount you prepay during the fixed rate period less 20% of the amount of credit; or
•	if the fixed rate period started on a date after the date we first advanced any part of the amount of credit, the loan account balance at the start of the fixed rate period – in which case the prepayment amount is the amount you prepay less 20% of the loan account balance at the start of the fixed rate period.

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Incurred when you apply for a new loan, additional funds on your current loan or when changing your loan.

fees.name: Documentation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The cost of preparing the loan documents for your new loan or application. The amount varies based on the complexity of the loan application.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To process the settlement of your loan, additional funds on your current loan or when changing your loan.

listData.name: Victorian Homebuyer Fund (Bendigo Complete Home Loan)
listData.description:
If you have a 5% deposit, the Victorian Government will contribute up to 25% of the purchase price for eligible participants and 35% for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders in exchange for an equivalent share in the property, whilst removing the need for Lenders Mortgage Insurance.

We’re proud to be a participating lender and look forward to helping even more Victorians into home ownership.

The Victorian Homebuyer Fund (VHF) mirrors the Bendigo Complete Home Loan offering a 100% offset account on both variable and fixed rates - allowing you to save interest.   

* Check Eligibility Criteria for Scheme Loans

The First Home Guarantee mirrors the Bendigo Complete Home Loan offering a 100% offset account on both variable and fixed rates - allowing you to save interest.

•	if the fixed rate period started on the date we first advanced any part of the amount of credit, the amount of credit – in which case the prepayment amount is the amount you prepay during the fixed rate period less 20% of the amount of credit; or
•	if the fixed rate period started on a date after the date we first advanced any part of the amount of credit, the loan account balance at the start of the fixed rate period – in which case the prepayment amount is the amount you prepay less 20% of the loan account balance at the start of the fixed rate period.

listData.name: Finance Lease
listData.description:
We purchase and own the asset and lease it to you for an agreed period. You may make an offer to purchase the asset at the end of the term. 100% finance of the purchase price (deposits not permitted).
We own the asset and normally the entire rental payment is tax deductable for you.
Flexible and tailored repayment structures depending on your cash flow needs.
A mandatory residual at the end of the term means you will benefit from lower rental instalments.
